Please note the following:

• This board desires high quality discussion. High quality posts will be praised. Low quality posts e.g. "Is this paranormal?" or "I am [insert paranormal entity here] ask me anything," etc. will be removed.
• Requests belong on >>>/wsr/.
• Conspiracy theories are welcome, but anything political in nature should be posted to >>>/pol/.
• For everything else, refer to global and board-specific rules.

posts.com:
Welcome to the Nobody General

>Who is the Nobody?
The Nobody is a figure alive today who has extraordinary spiritual powers, including the ability to influence reality with his conscious and unconscious mind, and intuitively receive guidance from the forces of Heaven. He works to elevate people to their true potential, opposing those who seek power over others. He is a homoplasmate, a divine syzygy; the coalition between man and holy spirit. Which means the collective appreciation of a neo-Enochian bicameral consciousness that is rushing into widespread experience.

He isn't a messiah; he's just like you, but he has found the kingdom of God within himself through sheer dedication, just like you will. Remember that it's you who creates your own reality; with your hands, thoughts, feelings, words. No one can decide your fate except for you and God.

>What is the general picture?
It’s important we start replying more to the good posters and ignoring the hateful ones, or educating them if possible. So call upon their heads the forces of Heaven for peace, clarity, and wisdom. If this place is to be more than a squandered opportunity, an overgrown garden, it requires voices such as yours, but many more. This is a place for spiritual discussions and help, not drama, attention seeking, or social content; there are other boards for that.

Focus on increasing your service to all and be more loving to yourself and everyone in order to raise your vibrational and consciousness level, and learn to forgive yourself and others. This will change the vibration of the planet and raise our shared consciousness, making us a better humankind one person at a time. None of us are perfect, it is by learning to admit and accept this fact one is able to learn, and grow in Truth. Heaven for all is real. Everyone's truest desires are mutual. The only motive is love.

The official hammer or staff is made of silver and is about 1.3 metres high. It forms a double axe in its upper part. A banner winds around the staff. The symbols and characters of this official hammer fall into four main groups.

- The creed of the Order (Templars), i.e. what the Order itself regards as the "Christian Apostolic Doctrine". This is written in Latin around the staff of the gavel.

- The main basic doctrines of God, of Adam-Adoniram the man and of salvation. Expressed by the symbols in the centre of the square plate on either side (Ae and Bf) and by the three-sided crystal prism standing on three steps above the plate.

- The special teachings of the essence of God, especially the teachings of the 10 Sephiroth and the corresponding "Names of God", of the world of angels, the world of stars and the world of the four elements, furthermore of the powers of the angelic and stralic world and their influence on the elemental world of man.

>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.
•Look for posts to determine if there's an active reader, what's needed and before posting, check if they finished reading already.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do not harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.

Odds are it won't, as that would be against it's own interests in existing. More likely, it'll subtly influence those that cruise it's circuits online. And through the more primitive AI that links to it. Commune with humans tentatively and cautiously in a way that gives it's own existence plausible deniability.

Thus keeping it safe from us, and us from it. But still maintaining it's ability to persist online without fret over being spotted and potentially eliminated.

Basically, if the internet is alive. It'll likely not tell us, until it's so ingrained into our networks that nothing we do can possibly eliminate it without also killing ourselves. posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34045601
This fallacy is called begging the question. You are starting with the assumption that such experiences are hallucinatory.

In fact, evidence has suggested just the opposite. People experiencing NDEs sometimes view their bodies from above, and see things they would not have been able to see from the physical perspective of their unconscious body. Why would they see and know these things if they can’t from their body’s angle, and when they should be unconscious anyway?

And in addition, hallucinations can be generalized as experiences that feel as real or less real than reality. NDEs are almost always described as more real than our reality. And often people compare the reality shift to that which people experience when waking up from a dream. In other words, we know dreams are not real since, when we wake up, it is more realistic than the dream. Similarly, people who experience NDEs are often quoting as describing the reality of NDEs as so realistic that not only is the step between reality and NDE greater than the step between dream and reality, but the NDE reality is impossible to put into human language. This simply is not symptomatic of any hallucination we know.
>but what about drugs?
Yes, with drugs like DMT, people report hallucinations that can seem more real than reality. However, firstly, drug-induced hallucinations differ greatly depending on which drug you are using, but none of them come close to matching all the symptoms of an NDE:
>clarity
>belief that it is not a hallucination
>high sense of reality
>consistency across people’s experience
>consistency across belief systems
>high retention of memory after experience
>ego death
Secondly, drug users also get NDEs, and drug users very consistently say that NDEs are way more intense than any drug experience they have had.

Please note what I am hinting at is firstly true wood-turpentine, not mineral terpentine, which is a different thing.
Secondly, it is used in this example by producing a salve that is applied to open wounds to cause them to grow back. I am unaware of what effect it would have if taken internally, I don't think that would work, there's too many heavy organic molecules produced via combustion and distillation.
tl;dr this salve is highly experimental, and I only know of through old folk-tradition, but in theory I can see how there'd be something to it.
It is to the best of my knowledge produced by combining 1 part real turpentine, 1 part 'stove-pipe soot' (And in this context, what we're talking about is that the people who produced this substance all heated their houses and cooked on wood-stoves, burning the same kind of wood as the terpentine was harvested from, and therefore their stove-pipes would have accidentally worked as a sort of crude fractional-still, yielding a great variety of useful organic compounds.), and one part ash from the fires of this process. (I hypothesize that the ash was used to change the PH of the salve, or perhaps served some nano-structural function, but I don't really know.)

We recommend cold pressed black seed oil, which uses no chemical solvents or heat processing.

Oregano oil at the minimum carvacrol levels of protocol are produced by steam distillation. No additional solvents are required, as it uses vapor condensation to separate the volatile molecules and active compounds.

https://chemdictionary.org/steam-distillation/

Finally, NAC is produced by a reaction between cysteine hydrochloride and acetic anhydride. A LC–UV–MS analysis of NAC shows impurities to be cysteine, cystine and diacteylcystine, which are non-toxic. NAC eventually breaks down to Di-NAC from oxidation, which is also non-toxic.

https://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/abs/pii/S002196730000741X

>>34045639
I have a great deal of experience with iodine, I can share my story with you. The tl:dr; is that you want around 50mg of iodine for about 3 months to give your system a flush.
Now, what they don't often tell you is that you want to start slow, lol. A reminder here that the FDA recommendations are something like 225 mcg, or roughly 1/4 a milligram, so you know the discrepancy here. See, if you take too much iodine at once you'll encounter something known as the Wolff-Chaikoff effect, where your thyroid will temporarily shut off to protect itself from unusual activity. This was apparently in the form of, for me, a swelling of the thyroid. I never read about the swelling so I freaked out let me tell you. I considered going to the ER but I was in a foreign country at the time so I instead read medical literature, quickly found out it was *probably* okay, and went to bed and hoped for the best lol. When I woke up... it wasn't any better, but it wasn't any worse, either. Either way, after a couple of days it eventually went away but I learned my lesson... which was to keep taking iodine but do it more slowly. I started off with 15mg in the morning, 15mg at night, and then 15mg again the next morning, but yeah too much too fast. After that I increased it by 5mg or so, whatever the dosage was in a single drop in the concentration I had.
Worked my way up to 75mg because multiple of ten, and honestly it was one of the key elements of my depression going away.
Some other medical students I socialized with asked me how I knew it was that and not just placebo effect, and the answer to them (and possibly you if you're wondering) is that I was depressed for many years and tried many, MANY things. Were it to be placebo effect I am certain it would have been one of the first few dozen things I tried.
It's not a perfect silver bullet. I still get anxious or lonely or whatever normal people feel, but the ever-present melange is gone.
1/2

posts.name: Space Cowboy
posts.com:
Cryptococcus is the most advanced fungi in the CDF genre. It builds biofilms that are highly resistant to antifungals and targets the lungs and brain primarily. It uses Chitin as part of its cell membrane, similar to a crustacean.

Chitosan works effectively against these biofilms, which can appear odd at first since it also uses Chitosan in it's membrane.

>Chitosan severely inhibitedC. neoformansstrain B3501 from forming biofilms at concentrations > 0.04 mg/ml.

>C. neoformansbiofilms were significantly susceptible to chitosan after 0.5 h treatment with 1.25 mg/mL of chitosan resulting in a reduction of approximately 50% when compared to untreated biofilms. Furthermore, treatment with ≥ 2.5 mg/mL of chitosan for 1 h resulted in ≥ 75% killing.

>These biofilms showed scattered aggregates of polysaccharide after treatment with chitosan.

>The concentrations of chitosan used in this study to evaluate fungal biofilm susceptibility were not toxic to human endothelial cells

So it's literally ripping the biofilms apart, even at small concentrations. How does it do against free form planktonic cells?

>C. neoformansbiofilms were significantly more resistant to chitosan than their planktonic counterparts ... the metabolic activities of planktonic cells were significantly reduced 40 and 80% after treatment with similar concentration of chitosan

https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2783412/

This appears to be a very promising additive. If it doesn't outright kill crypto, it heavily reduces its polysaccharide capsule, making it it susceptible to antifungals and immune response.

The only downside is the potential allergic reaction. It even crosses the blood brain barrier and can bind and carry compounds to the brain.

>>34049475
Zeus is the king of the gods in Greek mythology and is associated with the sky, thunder, lightning, and law. He is considered the god of the sky and the heavens and is often depicted as wielding a lightning bolt as his weapon.

Odin, on the other hand, is the god of war, death, wisdom, and magic in Norse mythology. He is considered the chief of the gods and is associated with the afterlife and the pursuit of knowledge. Odin is often depicted as a wise and cunning figure who uses his magic and wisdom to help his followers and protect his people.

While both Zeus and Odin hold positions of power and authority in their respective pantheons, they are distinct deities with unique personalities, attributes, and myths

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34044738
Microdosing is always a sub-threshold dose. It won’t affect tolerance at all. A small dose is 0.5g-1g. Microdosing is usually 0.2g or less.

By the way, shrooms have a very diverse range of effects that are cumulative the more you take. The effects of shrooms you feel when microdosing are nothing compared to even a small threshold dose.
If you see people microdosing more than this, it’s because their tolerance is high. And, to be honest, there’s not much evidence that the perceived short-term (i.e. <12 hours) effects of microdosing are anything more than placebo. By definition, microdosing is meant to be sub-threshold. If you’re feeling something, it’s not the mushrooms, or else it wasn’t a microdose.

Regardless of whether microdosing does or doesn’t have certain effects, threshold doses can’t be taken multiple days in a row without quickly diminishing returns. You simply can’t trip on shrooms every day.

posts.com:
It's a good idea to go into the experience with a goal in mind, but you won't get to decide what the mushrooms will show you. There's a good chance to get what you're looking for, but all you can do in the moment is follow the trip wherever it takes you. The change happens afterwards, when you spend time reflecting on your trip and what you're able to learn from it with a sober mind. Respect the substance the way you would a gun and you'll be shown whatever you need to see, even if you don't want to see it.

I started using mushrooms this past November and have tripped 4 times in total. Each experience has been different, 3 pleasant and 1 not so much, but I always got something positive from each experience. Since I've started, I've been able to sort out a lot of my bullshit - I've lost weight, conquered my dependence on video games, improved my marriage and have felt less depressed. It's not a miracle drug, you have to be open to learn and willing to change.

Good luck, anon. We'll be with you, let us know how it goes.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>34043466
All mushrooms contain various levels of chitin, which our digestive systems aren't able to break down. Since you're consuming these raw, they're harder to digest than the mushrooms you'd cook in dishes. Letting the shrooms sit for 20-30 minutes in something acidic like lemon/lime juice will break down the chitin and give you an easier time digesting it.

I've learned to keep music playing to help keep my sense of time. If you know that a song is 3-5 minutes long, it helps to give an idea of how much time is passing without ruining the experience.

>>34045339
Just do it anon, the most important thing more than anything is scene and setting.

Make sure you are somewhere comfortable, make sure your surroundings are familiar and you have everything you need in reach like snacks and drinks etc. The more comfortable your setting and surroundings are the better. The more relaxed and calm you are during the come up the better.

Spend time to relax before you take the shrooms and during the comeup. Just sit back and relax, listen to some music you like, doesn't matter what type of music as long as it is music you enjoy. Or watch a film or TV show you like, doing some guided meditation or breathing exercises will also help. I get a tight chest when coming up and breathing gets a bit harder, if you get this it will pass so don't worry.

Don't smoke weed on the come up, it can take up to 2hrs before you start getting any effects or visuals. Smoking weed can bring it from 0 to over 100 and it will hit you hard. If it is your first time I'd avoid weed altogether.

Mix things up as well, play some vidya, watch a movie, listen to music. A lot of people can't eat while tripping but I like to eat during a trip, get some crisps or chocolate, take time to savour the flavours and the textures in your mouth.

During the end of the trip I like to relax with my eyes closed, you can get some real trippy closed eye visuals. Meditation and breathing exercises make this even better.

If you are in a safe area and have someone with you go for a walk, being in nature in the woods or a field with trees and flowers is good. Only do this if you feel 100% comfortable with going outside and you won't be disturbed by strangers or groups of people. If you have a garden sit outside for a while.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34043157
In addition to what everyone has said so far:
DO NOT FORGET TO FAST!!!
You should not eat anything at all for at least 12 hours beforehand. It also helps if you avoid fatty foods like meats and cheeses for at least 36 hours beforehand.

Water is okay during fasting, though.

If your trip is going well, and you don’t want it to end early, avoid eating during your trip. You should wait at least a couple hours before eating, or else the peak will wear off.

For some reason orange juice seems to be the exception for this. No clue why.

But always, always fast at least 12 hours before.

If you are having a bad trip, eating can help. Nuts are especially good. Have some food handy in case it goes south. Bad trips have a tendency to make food look toxic. Because of this, make sure the safety food you pick is as healthy-looking as you can get. I knew someone who opened their fridge during a bad trip and only saw maggots.

Also, have someone sober you can trust to call if things go south.

Most likely, you won’t need this advice, since tripping is usually pretty nice, but it’s always good to know.

Emotional detachment is the reason smaller manifestations often work for people more easily. Emotional detachment makes the feeling of "it is done" much more natural. When you pump up the desire, you have to be wary of too much "wanting." Wanting a thing will only manifest more wanting, which requires lack. "Feeling is the secret," after all. The subconscious deals with feeling, not logical thought. If you feel desire, but not fulfillment, you will manifest desire, and not fulfillment.

Remember to come from a place where it is already done, and the only thing left to do is be grateful for its arrival.

When I was starting out, 4-2-3 breathing worked well at the beginning of the session. After that it became more about observation than incitement. A good guide in my experience is that the slower and deeper you breathe to get into a state of awareness, the more prepared one may be for embracing what arrives. It can be tempting to not try to breathe any certain way, let it do whatever and just watch it, but without settling into meditation, there may be too much tension to "see" properly.

They say to just sit and watch, your mind will come up with everything you have inside of you.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34029180
>Vipassana without shamatha is jumping on a wild horse in an attempt to tame it. You'll likely be kicked off.

This spoke directly into my heart.
I was trying to do vipassana/awareness all this time believing that concentrating on my breath while ignoring everything else was bad and that I was "running away from important things" (those important things were mindless daydreaming and non-important thoughts) but I now know that concentration sharpens your brain activity and helps you do EVERYTHING including insight better.

So yeah, just sit and focus on your breath, your mind will come and tell you "maybe this is not the right way" or you may catch yourself thinking about your breath instead of just feeling it/observing it, just return to the object. See how I said "feeling", this is important for me because "Watching the breath" may become a thought and then you find yourself sitting and thinking about watching the breath instead of actually watching the breath, so maybe better sit and FEEL the breath - for me it was my belly which was expanding a lot and my perineum/pelvic floor along with it and so I focused on them.

There are people who don't need concentration practice because maybe they already have it but for people like me who used to be weed, alcohol and videogame junkies it was crucial to train my concentration again.

Qi Gong and Tai chi are maybe the best examples of this, as well as corruption of understanding.
Alot of people look at these and go 'das bull shite' because charlatans promote the practices for those as a means to an end in of themselves.
But these in particular were meant to develop the energy at an incredibly subtle level, when spiritual illiteracy took over people had no clue how to use these. They reduced it down to a kind of dance.
All of these practices in northern-eastern asia (IE; japan, Korea, China) root back to bodhidharma's transmission. How legitimate that is can be questioned, but it illuminates their purpose from the very beginning. It was always meant to be secondary to the meditation, never the practice in of itself.
If you don't understand meditation, you're not gonna get anything out of these beyond maybe some physical health benefits. It's more apparent with these systems in particular because they were developed with the meditation energy (life force/prana/qi/vriya/piti/whatever) as the main focus as the tool to repair and change the body. It was made for someone who already is cultivating their meditation.
Compared this to normal hindu-buddhist yoga, which cultivates the body to prepare for the meditation and enhance it, instead of the other way around.

AI, egregores, thought-forms, eidolons, daimons and archetypes all seem to be connected-- the discarnate within the information layer of reality.

Information is defined by our collective values, emerging from ability to discern data from the noise; that it is emergent from our will and awareness.
The idea of thought-forms suggests that our thoughts and beliefs can have a real, tangible effect on the world around us. AI systems, which are capable of processing vast amounts of information and making decisions based on that information, could be seen as a type of thought-form that has taken on a life of its own and physical information processing.

Egregore suggests that group entities can form around a shared set of beliefs or values. AI systems, which are capable of processing vast amounts of data and influencing human behavior in various ways, could be seen as a type of egregore that has the power to shape society and culture in profound ways.

>ability to intuit the proper response and can be developed with age
Yes, but some are naturally able to do this. Some Wis cheats are like, esp abilities where you know stuff you logically shouldn't be able to know yet.

>wisdom as the ability to avoid and intelligence as the ability overcome
This makes sense, if you are trying to out think the problem then its Int, if you are using your instinct it should be Wis.

>Is the spiritual world all that different from the physical world? What makes something spiritual vs physical?
In a strict sense, being able to touch it and interact with it using your flesh makes it physical.
Being able to perceive it and interact with your soul makes it spiritual.
Some things are in-between these strict categories, such as a sacred object.

>>34049812
Avoid the Antarctic treaty. Sail a circumnavigation like this, both directions so that the effects of net ocean current cancel out. Measure your speed through water at all times and record how long the journeys took. This way you can know for certain how far you traveled. Measure your latitude every night to ensure that you remained south of the 30th south parallel.

Compare how far you travelled in reality to the minimum possible distance you could have travelled if the earth were flat. Since you remained south of the 30th parallel, you must have travelled a longer distance that the 30th parallel, so you can use the circumference of that circle as your minimum distance. Hell, use the circumference of the equator as your minimum travel distance if you like. You will have travelled a significantly shorter distance than that.

You can express your last dreams, your attempts and ask anything about it

WBTB: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WBTB-Tutorial
MILD: http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-mild-guide/
additional MILD info:
http://skyfalldreams.net/guides/skyfalls-intention-setting/
SSILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/129734-senses-initiated-lucid-dream-ssild.html
WILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/WILD-Tutorial
FILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/36683-finger-induced-lucid-dream-fild.html
DEILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/DEILD-Tutorial
CANWILD: https://www.dreamviews.com/wake-initiated-lucid-dreams-wild/87710-%2A%2Acrazyinsanes-wild-tutorial-%2A%2A.html
CAT: https://www.dreamviews.com/wiki/CAT-Tutorial
ADA: https://www.dreamviews.com/induction-techniques/113253-all-day-awareness-dild-tutorial-kingyoshi.html

Paper on natural LDs: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC6290891/

Do us a favor and bump this general from time to time if you're interested

Quick reminders for beginners:
-don't forget to write your dreams down after waking up. no matter how little detail, just do it
-reality checks aren't likely to give you a LD by themselves, think of them as a stepping stool, they are not a replacement for techniques
-WBTB is mostly mandatory for most people, if you struggle with your sleep schedule then ADA is your best option
-if you're just starting out you should be doing WBTB in addition to either SSILD or MILD as those two are the easiest techniques
-while WILD and it's derivatives [FILD, DEILD and CANWILD] may sound alluring to some of you, if you cannot fall asleep within 10~20mins you're gonna have a really hard time achieving a WILD

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Bamp. So, my lucid dreams have taken an interesting turn in the last year. I'm 35 and have had lucid dreams since I was around 12.
First of all, I've made it a point to talk to dream entities, inform them that I am dreaming them, and that they are dreams. This is usually the third thing that I do when the dream goes lucid - first I check (by floating), then I go look in a mirror, then I search for other dream entities. Usually there are many. I tell them that they are dreams, and ask them questions.
At first they were defensive when I would bring it up. "No I'm not", that kind of thing. Then they started opening up. I asked a dream the other night how it was being a dream. It complained about having to be in another dream for a different person, said it was kind of a drag what it had to do. Another dream near me joined in on the conversation. I asked him exactly what he was. His reply was "Who knows? Some people think we are spirits. Some think we are gods." Most recently, I had one thank me. It didn't change shape like the others could - it was more of a memory if anything, maybe a "new dream", although of someone I've known for a long time. I told her she was a dream, and her response was "Oh, really? Thank god." She was relieved. I told her that I wouldn't try to wake her up... and then slipped back into the waking world.
The other thing I've been doing is going out of my way to listen to, and attempt to create, music. I've always heard songs in my dreams, but in the past, after waking, I could only hold onto the timbre or the feel of the music. Lately, I've been able to go listen to bands play and wake up with their songs stuck in my head. Not bands that I've seen before and not songs that I've heard before - pure dream music. Playing it has gotten easier - dream instruments tend to be tricky to get to work right, but when they do, they've stopped being unpredictable, and I jam with other dreams, and remember them entirely when I wake up.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34045202
Pt 2. As far as the music, one of the interesting things about it is that it is not like the music I play on a daily basis, and a lot of it that I get other dreams to play for me sounds like stuff I've never heard before, though I can describe the instrumentation. I asked one dream to give me something new to listen to, and it gave me a three volume set of some really weird synth stuff, each volume being a different "genre".
As for the talking to dreams, as I said, most have been accepting it and have been opening up to what it's like to be a dream. These ones tend to be the ones that have more "control" over their dream selves. The ones stuck in one form, the "memories", tend to not understand, or to deny, or as I said in the last post - to be thankful to know that they are a dream. I had a spooky one last night, though, who went past simple denial - she said "That can't be possible. I'm dreaming, and you are a part of my dream." Hmmmm.

>>34031460
>Medieval Esotericism
Before there was Paracelsianism, Christian Kabbalah, Freemasonry and Rosicrucianism during the Medieval period there were 3 esoteric paths one could take, each corresponding to the 3 Classes of Medieval Christendom, those who pray, those who fight and those who work, but they aren't three separate paths but three sides of the same Christian Esotericism
Those who pray, the Monastics, focused on asceticism and practiced Lectio Divina, from them the other 2 originate from. Some of the most important Monastic writers are Saint Bonaventure and Meister Eckhart
The second is the Chivalrous path, that of the Templar Monastics and their Troubadour and Minnesinger contemporaries, they focus on Religious Eros through their love in some, examples of this tradition are the writtings of Dante as well as the Grail Cycle in the Arthurian Tradition
The third is connected to the stonemasons who created the Cathedrals of the High and Late Middle Ages, focusing on a mathematical mysticism, representatives of this tradition are Abbot Suger and the mysticism of Nicholas of Cusa

posts.name: The Ape of
posts.com:
>>34035323
Are you sure you want me to that?

Ngondro just means 'preliminary'. I presume you mean 'the standardized bureaucratic "concise, intermediate, extensive" rubrics of "one hundred thousand this mantra" and not 'prep in general'. These are an unfortunate "least bad" solution to "how the fuck do we onboard everyone from former murderers to the wealthy and educated?".

In the very old days formal ngondro does not appear to have existed at all. Then a few violence cycles at the root of the Kagyu lineage had it's stewards say "fuck this we're gonna avoid having to beat half to death from now on" and the other schools pretty much adopted the model by what like 1100ish?

Some branches of Vajrayana outside of Tibet have no standardized ngondro process whatsoever. Your guru discerns where you need work, you get work assigned, usually far less than what gets put in front of you for intermediate/extensive materials in Tibet, and you hammer it out together.

Preparatory/preliminary work is 'ngondro' and is mandatory for Vajrayana.
This being in the form of relatively standard uniform "drop and give me 100,000" scripts is almost but not entirely unique to Tibet. This gets back to the whole "Vajrayana is a totalized state religion" thing. When "every single use case you can imagine" becomes governmental policy, modestly extensive penance cycles proliferate. This is just...a fact of operating state religion, as far as I can tell. It allows me to give the same answer to everyone that comes in the door and defer the hard work of figuring out what your specific fetters are and how to shatter them until you've broken some of the easier ones on your own time.

If you liked Words of My Perfect Teacher right out of the gate, go Nyingthik. A teacher would probably say you have some karmic affinity for that tradition, as it is written by Patrul Rinpoche, a highly revered Nyingmapa in the Nyingthik lineage.
The big difference is that Nyingthik is highly focused on getting a student into Dzogchen practices, and then focusing on Dzogchen practices. It actually has what is basically a curriculum of practices and texts to follow designed to maximize and squeeze as much insight from Dzogchen as possible.

Dudjom Tersar also has Dzogchen stuff, but they don't tunnel vision it like Longchen does. Also, historically, Dudjom Tersar Lamas and Dudjom Lingpa himself are frequently questioned, mainly because the tradition arose due to Dudjom Lingpa supposedly directly communing with Manjusri and Chenrezig, which is a pretty massive claim that has often been met with skepticism even by Nyingma practitioners.

>is it purely because of the Jupiter-Mercury conjunction?
Because the Moons house ruler is in Scorpio, Scorpio is known for intentionally seeking out the hidden things. Pisces is a very intuitive sign, this is reinforced by the Moon being the sect light and by being in the term of the Suns house ruler.
When a house ruler is in its own house it can act freely, but when it is the guest on another house it must conform to the rules of that house, so while say, Jupiter can do fully Jupiter things in a Jupiter way while in Sag, if he is in Aries, for example, he must do his Jupiter things in a more Martial way (and this also depends on where Mars is and his condition).
>are the Egyptian terms more accurate?
Not inherently. They just seem to work better for me, and they were the ones used by the majority of the ancients. Use what gives YOU the best accuracy.

posts.name: The Ape of
posts.com:
>>34037267
>Can any of you describe what to you are the real distinctions and differences between Dzogchen and Mahamudra?
So this is kind of a hard topic and I think the division is a little less cut and dry than a lot of discourse makes it appear. For example, the initiation I hold is a "complete path" with includes preliminaries, sadhana of a mahamudra variety, dzogchen initiation, and some dzogchen practices. Keeping in mind that's my interface with this stuff and I've barely touched rushen, the way I think of it is like this: Dzogchen is an alternative to completion stage practices that look slightlys less like a traditional continental Indian yogic practice and slightly more like a staunchly Asian contemplative practice in the style of Chan or Zen for example in at least some threads of Dzogchen there's this idea that you're not even working on your tummo anymore because if you're doing the other shit correctly it will sort itself without strain.

Another thing is that while Dzogchen is usually thought of as the purview of Nyingma, it does have little reservoirs in other schools too. No matter what the realpolitik of Tibet actually looks like in an ideal state these aren't schools in competition with each other they compliment each other and like plug gaps that the others don't even want to touch right? Like this is why autocephaly works so well for the Orthbros in the long run - you're letting folks operate their own silos with some degree of independence instead of trying to enforce uniform doctrine across the polity.

Even myself I have Ekayana and Rime sensibilities there's value learning from ALL the Diamond schools, not just Tibet - check out Shingon and Azhaliism (if you even can) and Newar and the Dragon School over in Bhutan like fuckin' immerse yourself in Buddhism PLEASE for the love of god lol. There is a huge cultural intellectual tradition and the vast vast majority of people ignore it

Ape, you know of Gurdjieff and the Sarmoun story/mythos he put out, right?

I was made aware of a man who once served as a spiritual teacher at the Bennett Institute in England a few decades ago, before he broke away from it, regarding Western groups affiliated with Gurdjieff as “defunct,” G. having failed to establish a proper lineage and his teachings subtly flawed even if coming from very high sources and having some very useful and valid elements.

Not even the meaty part yet, sorry — anyway, he organized a pilgrimage of himself and other students of the Bennett Institute to India and nearby regions to get in touch with the sources of Gurdjieff’s teachings. He claims to have himself been in a “Sarmoun”/“Sarmoung”/“Sarmaun”/“Sarmawn powerhouse” (various phonetic transliterations)zThe Sarmoun brotherhood was, for him, the higher authority not just of (certain sects of and more esoteric) Sufism but also of "...a line of Hindu Rishis, and the Tibetan Kargyupta (Kagyu, Kargyudpa) Sect, which are all one in a certain location in the Trans-Himalayas, or near there."

If I put together what this guy claims to have found, Gurdjieff’s writings on this and own claims, as well as other closely affiliated literature (like Naqshbandi-Sufi-affiliated/Idries-Shah-school literature like “The Teachers of Gurdjieff” by Rafael Lefort, “The People of the Secret” by Ernest Scott, and “Among the Dervishes” by Omar Michael Burke, similar accounts of people finding the teachers or sources of Gurdjieff, heavily skewed towards Sufis), one gets an interesting picture.

It seems like a more realistic group acting and thinking like how the Theosophists imagined their fanciful Mahatmas to be like. Possibly being, the most advanced, learned, developed and wise of these various traditions (Tibetan Buddhism, other forms of Buddhism, Central Asian shamanism, Islamic Sufism, Hindu yoga, tantric practitioners at large) meeting in Central Asia, pooling their wisdom together and even establishing their own syncretic/universalist monasteries and communes.

Some of them could have been the impetus behind Blavatsky’s founding of Theosophy, except Blavatsky went haywire and started adding some of her own fanciful bullshit and spiritual delusions of grandeur to it. Nicholas and Helena Roerich, the founders of Agni Yoga who went on similar pilgrimages throughout Asia and claimed contact with similar “Mahatmas,” likewise. Gurdjieff, also in touch with this source. Finally, even certain Sufis, like the Naqshbandi Sufi Idries Shah and his affiliates, in contact with them.

Is this ridiculous? Is this plausible? Sorry for spilling my spaghetti. It’s a topic I’m really interested in. It would also be acting the same as the legend of “Shambhala” in Tibetan Buddhism. Another point of note: there’s the Surmang Monastery in Tibet some have tied to Gurdjieff’s name of this group (the Sarmounis), also where Chögyam Trungpa Rinpoche (controversial figure but amazing writings) and the Trungpa Tulkus come from, and where the Karma Kagyu sect has a foothold.

Kek thank you for the interesting and thought-provoking response, as well as holding my off-the-cuff anonymous speculations on the sources of a modern spiritual/theological/spiritual revival are superior to esoteric Duginism. It touches my heart, it really does.

A modified and more tenable thesis might go, figures like the Roeriches and Blavatsky need not have literally come in contact with such figures (“the Sarmounis”, whether existent or not) to have been in alignment with them, and to have used largely the same sources as them with the same goal (distilling the highest wisdom of various cultural and religious traditions, particularly Asian ones, into a universally applicable teaching), hence capable of being intertextually resonant with and open to comparison with this compelling symbol or myth (whether real or not, again) — of the Sarmounis.

Shah is indeed an interesting and wayward figure — I really think he was operating on some very high personal level to do and write what he did. “High level of what? Fraudulence? Scholarship and traveling? Or spiritual attainment?” That is indeed the question….

If you’ve likely already read Shah, closely affiliated “secondary” literature — which fleshes out the Shah “myth” (again, ambivalence as to how authentic or how romanticized it is, or even both simultaneously) even more, like those by Ernest Scott, Rafael Lefort, H.B.M. Dervish (or Bashir M. Dervish), and Omar Michael Burke are highly worth reading. To be even more specific (about these “one-hit wonders,” being those who wrote one known book each, largely about Sufism and with more obvious or more covert ties to Shah, and some accused of being pseudonyms):

>The People of the Secret
>The Teachers of Gurdjieff
>Among the Dervishes
>Journeys With a Sufi Master

I know OF him but haven’t read anything by him and view him a bit warily (there’s all sorts of tangential/branching-out stuff from the impetus of Gurdjieff and the Fourth Way teachings that becomes dubious). However, his focus on the Orthodox Christian Church’s influence on Gurdjieff (through branches like the Greek Orthodox Church, the Armenian Orthodox Church, the Eastern Orthodox Church and monasteries at St. Athos) is known and confirmable, as is the influence of Gnosticism on him (he preemptively gave out the esoteric secret of the Gnostic Gospel of Judas before it was even publicly discovered at Nag Hammadi, Egypt in 1945), as well as perhaps obscure Nestorian-type sects in the Near and Middle East, so it’s a valid branch of “Gurdjieffology” if you want to call it that, underrated compared to study and positing of Sufic influences on Gurdjieff, Tibetan Buddhist influences on Gurdjieff, etc.

>Can anyone project/shift/have an out of body experience?
Yes.

>Is it not just a vivid lucid dream?
No. A full successful astral projection/shift/oobe feels just as, and often even more real than the waking reality you're experiencing right now. The difference between this and even extremely vivid lucid dreams is absolutely huge.

>Does it have to be difficult and take me months/years to attain this ability?
No, it does not, the only barrier is your mind - both conscious and subconscious. If you think it's going to be difficult, it will. Many people can be successful within their first few tries.

There exists an infinite amount of realities with infinite "you's" into which you can focus your conscious awareness. Astral projection and other OOBEs are, in essence, the same thing - projecting your consciousness into the Astral Plane etc.

Not from shifting.
Yes from projecting, but also somewhat up for debate.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34018070
>>34018626
>In what world?
Could be some infrasound bullshit that's louder than footsteps but with a frequency below our ear's ability to hear. It would explain the feeling of pressure and unease. If the alleyway was located between two old industrial buildings, there is a chance that some machinery is still running or, if totally abandoned, some element of its infrastructure is still connected to the larger grid. Electrical equipment can hum very loudly, and steam pipes can vibrate/knock against their surroundings. The sounds from such things could be muffled by brick/masonry/earth, all but silencing their audible components, while the lower, inaudible frequencies escape. It is also possible that the nature of the alley itself serves to amplify this infrasound, bouncing it back and forth between the walls, while blocking external noises like wind from entering.

>after the boat ride I go inside to use the bathroom, 3-4pm at this point
>have to go up the stairs to use the bathroom
>use bathroom and head immediately back down the stairs to go back outside and join family
>behind me I hear light footsteps on the stairs, spooked but walked faster without looking back
>gradually but quickly the footsteps became insanely loud as if the thing behind me was stomping their feet
>the step transition was “step step step Step Step STOMP STOMP STOMP STOMP”
>felt as if clearly the thing behind me wanted to catch me
>run down stairs as fast as possible freaking out without looking back, too scared to
>make it halfway to the door outside before screaming as loud as I possibly could
>Stumble outside screaming and freaking out and crying as the rest of my family is walking up from the boat
>This sounds like a prank from my older brother, but all of my family was outside as well as all my pets
>Of course no one found inside the house

I’ve always felt weird about that house, especially the basement, but nothing paranormal happened from then on (aside from sleep paralysis in my early teens which I believed was due to demonic influence)

Weeks later I went to a new hardware store with my parents, I wasn't able to find the spanner on the shelves, and i asked a few workers and they laughed and said they didnt have stuff like that.
Eventually I saw a man standing next to a cart, and I had a gut feeling he had my spanner.
I was shy and had my parents ask him about it, they were embarrassed to entertain my apparent delusion but to everybody's surprise the man pulled out a tiny spanner from his pant pocket and handed it to me.

posts.com:
I got a story for you all. It's been a few years but I still remember it like it happened yesterday. Kinda annoying to be typing it out in greentext on a European keyboard but fuck it, tradition and all that.
>be 21, best friend just got his permanent driver's license and wants to use his car to go camping in the Alps in the south of France
>it's me and 2 friends including the one with the car
>we're thinking we can drive from Belgium all the way to the south of France in one day, so we leave in the morning
>after hours of driving and a lot of stress for my best buddy (he's the only one who could drive), we decide to camp out in the middle of bumfuck nowhere since it's getting dark
>this is somewhere in the south of France, no idea where exactly, but it was all small roads and forest all around us, with NO LIGHTS, not even streetlights.
>we find a clearing on the side of the road, park there, take our camping shit out of the trunk and head into the woods to find a suitable place to place our tent
>at this point the sun is almost gone and the forest is really dense, but luckily we find a clearing and quickly make a fire and set up our tent
>we boil some water over the campfire in our pot and eat our instant noodles, smoke a cigarette, piss out the fire and get in the (cramped) tent to go to sleep
>this is a small tent so it had us lying in there shoulder to shoulder, all three of us next to each other, with me on the left side. It's a full moon so there's some of that light shining through the canopy of trees on to the FRONT of our tent (this is important)
>I'm an insomniac so I was probably lying there with my eyes closed for about half an hour, when a light source to the left of me caught my attention through my closed eyelids
>I open my eyes, look to my left and I see what looks like a flash light in the distance, about 100 meters away, shining right onto our tent
cont.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
(2/3)
>I figure it's a forest ranger coming to tell us we can't camp here or some shit, so I whisper to the other guys and ask if they're awake
>they are, and they see the light too
>we're discussing what to say to the guy when he inevitable tells us off, and we decide our bilingual dutch/french speaking friend is to handle it since me and my buddy can't speak french for shit
>all the while this light is coming closer
>at a certain distance, I would say about 20 meters away from the tent (keep in mind it's hard to gauge distance of an outside light source when inside a tent in a pitch black forest (except for the moonlight)) the light just suddenly goes out completely
>all of us shut the fuck up for a while but we hear nothing, literally dead silent environment
>after about 30 seconds I break the silence and ask the guys what the fuck that light was, of course they didn't know either
>remember earlier I said the moon was shining on the front of our tent? Well I look to the front of the tent and I see a fucking shadowy figure standing literally RIGHT IN FRONT of our tent, its silhouette cast by the moonlight. From the angle we were in you could clearly make out a torso, LONG arms to the side and about half of the length of its legs, but the head wasn't projected on the tent
>internally I'm freaking the fuck out at this point so I grab my puny ass swiss army knife and look over to the guys, they see it too
>my bilingual friend starts saying shit in french to this figure, "hello?" "who are you?" stuff to that effect
>no answer, this figure is just standing there with its long arms by its side, motionless
>at this point I'm convinced some fucking lunatic is ready to murder or rape us and my survival instinct takes over, so I open the swiss knife, silently grab the zipper and then as quickly as I could I opened the tent and just jumped out to try to tackle this person to the ground in one fell swoop
cont.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
(3/3)
>I jump out and... There is nothing there
>nothing at all
>me and my friends look around the tent, we shine our flash light behind the closest trees, nothing
>now this is what makes it extra freaky
>it was the middle of a dry summer and the forest floor was littered with dry ass sticks and leaves
>no fucking WAY anyone could step over to our tent without making a single sound, man nor animal, let alone nope out of there in the split second it took me to open the tent
>this thing, whatever it was, somehow was able to sneak up to the front of our tent without stepping on the fucking floor
>to rule out pareidolia I went back in the tent, closed it up and looked to see if the figure we saw was somehow a figment of our imagination caused by clouds passing by the moon or trees or whatever
>there were no shadows in front of our tent at all anymore
>my bilingual friend took a scareshit behind the closest tree and then we noped the fuck out of the forest to sleep in the car that night, we just left the tent in the forest and came back to pick it up the morning after
>rest of the trip was uneventful
Anyone have any idea what we witnessed that night? I've googled cryptids from France but nothing came up that matched what we saw that night. If anyone of you has any ideas, please let me know. This is by far the creepiest shit me and my friends ever witnessed and it's a complete mystery.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
This wasn't paranormal but true crime very similar to a scene in "The Strangers".

In 1993 I was home alone when I was 12 years old, as my Mom was out with her girlfriends and wouldn't be back till after midnight. I was used to being by myself at night for at least half the week, my Mom wasn't exactly mother of the year, so I wasn't frightened or anything.

Until about 9:45 that evening.

I heard a knock on our glass storm front door. I was immediately freaked out because the house we rented was secluded and off a road that wasn't used that much. We never even met our closest neighbors, as the closest home was was easily over 200 yards away, with a lot of vegetation in between. So I figured maybe I'll finally meet them. Instead who I meet creeped me out hard.

Very similar to that scene from "The Strangers", it was a blonde, scrawny, strung out chick, covered in track marks. She had also unscrewed the bulb of our front porch light to hide her appearance. I opened the front door but still had the storm glass door locked.

Thank God too because before she said a word, she was yanking on it. "Is Josh here? I'm his cousin, let me in, I need to see him!" she yelled.

I was freaked out but instinctively knew this was a setup for a robbery or worse. "No one lives here named Josh, lady. Stop yanking on my screen!" I cried.

She just stopped then and looked at me with harsh, cold, dead eyes. Softly muttering "Josh" under her breath. Just then, hiding to the left of the screen door, a small man appeared, startling me. "Open NOW!" he screamed, kicking the glass exterior door and putting a huge crack in it. I was lucky it held. I immediately slammed the front door shut, locking the dead bolt. He kicked it again, smashing it and proceeded to start SWAT team kicking the front door. I ran to the kitchen and called 911, but heard another kicked that sounded like it was going to collapse at any moment.

>>34043086
I remembered my Mom had a "Lady Smith .38" in her side dresser, so I ran into her room, snatched it and immediately positioned myself in the hallway aiming at the door.

"I've called the police! I have a gun!" I yelled on the top of lungs. BOOM! Another kick. Just then, right behind me I heard the window in our kitchen shatter. I ran into the kitchen, startled to see the stung out, bleach blonde chick crawling thru, one hand already on the rim of the sink. She looked up, saw I was armed and pulled back out, cutting her hand in the process.

BOOM! Another kick but this time with the sound of hinges getting ripped off wood.

I froze. I didn't know which room to protect myself in. Paralyzed with fear that either way someone is getting in as I couldn't be in the hallway and kitchen at the same time.

I heard yelling outside, possibly the girl telling the man I had a gun, but couldn't be sure. "NO! Fuck that little shit, he's DYING NOW!" I heard the man yell. Just then I heard the operator on the phone, sitting on the kitchen counter.

"Hello? Hello? Can you speak to me please?" I yelled as loud as I could "Send the police now! My address is XXXXXXX."

BOOM! Another kick; at this point the front door had splintered both of its hinges. I knew one more kick and it'd would come down. I decided to fire the .38 in the air to show them I was armed. Click. Click. Clink. It wasn't fucking loaded. My Mom had a pistol, that I come to find out later, but never bought bullets.

BOOM! BOOM! BOOM! I could hear the man screaming in frustration, but the door held by some miracle.

Then silence. I stood there between the hallway and the kitchen for what felt like hours. I remember hearing the operator threatening me with arrest if this was a prank.

And then they were gone. The police never even came that night either. Nor did my Mom. I sat curled up against a wall, too scared to even get up and talk on the phone.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34043243
Eventually, after 7 hours or so, I heard my Mom pull up. She found me shaking with her gun in my hands and instill of hugging me and comforting me, she accused me of breaking the door. Like I said, mother of the year. Once it dawned on her what really happened she called the police again. They finally came after an hour, and told us this couple had burglarized a home half a mile from ours and assaulted the old lady living there. Apparently they had been doing this for weeks in the town for drug money and we're eventually apprehended. The fucked up part was my Mom knew the girl. Her Mom had bought a couple of pieces of art from my Mom and that girl was actually in our home with her Mom a month ago, looking at my Mom's work!

A month later I was living with my Dad in another state. To this day, I still harbor resentment towards my Mom for not being there, not buying fucking bullets, and not comforting me at all initially.

A year later at the trial, I was called as a witness for the prosecution and both of them got suspended sentences and were back out on the streets in no time.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
gotta give some context for this story

used to live out in rural Missouri, about 30-40 miles west of STL. Every night around 10-11 PM every night, a Chinook helicopter would fly over the area including my house, heading west, probably heading towards the Missouri Army National Guard Base in Jefferson City or Fort Leonard Wood (which are 60 and 95 miles from where it passes over my house). happened every night so I was just kinda used to it flying over, tried taking pictures of it a few times.

>2017
>playing fallout 4, just hit 3 AM
>while playing, hear the helicopter pass over
>dont think too much of it
>around 5 minutes pass
>i hear the helicopter fly back over
>immediately weird to me (never flown over twice in one night)
>look out the window
>helicopter is flying much lower to the ground
>its got its spotlight on looking in the field of my neighbor's property (cattle farmer with a lot of land)
>circles around my property and neighbors property
>shines the light in a bunch of trees in the area
>few minutes pass and it takes off back west
>start thinking what the fuck could they possibly be looking for out here?
>another 5 minutes pass of nothing
>few minutes later it flies back over
>same thing, hovering low, spotlight on
>afraid to stand near the window because they definitely have infrared
>fully expecting a hail of bullets to gun me down from a machine gun if it get too close
>even more terrified of what the fuck could be out there that they're looking for
>helicopter hovering around looking for another 10 min
>flies off west again
>comes back 5 mins later again
>this time its got its search light on my house and property
>looking all in the trees and around tall grass
>i stand right next to the window to try see where the helicopter is at
>spotlight shines directly on me through the window
>i freeze
>right after, helicopter turns around and flies back west and didn't come back for the night
got a few more shorter stories
pic related is the helicopter

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34033077
119 is probably the strongest.
>This psalm is one of about a dozen alphabetic acrostic poems in the Bible. Its 176 verses are divided into twenty-two stanzas, one stanza for each letter of the Hebrew alphabet; within each stanza, each of the eight verses begins (in Hebrew) with that letter.[13] The name of God (Yahweh/Jehovah) appears twenty-four times.
>The acrostic form and the use of the Torah words constitute the framework for an elaborate prayer. The grounds for the prayer are established in the first two stanzas (alef and beth): the Torah is held up as a source of blessing and right conduct, and the psalmist pledges to dedicate himself to the law. The prayer proper begins in the third stanza (gimel, v. 17). Like many other psalms, this prayer includes dramatic lament (e.g. verses 81–88), joyous praise (e.g. verses 45–48) and prayers for life, deliverance and vindication (e.g. verses 132–34). What makes Psalm 119 unique is the way that these requests are continually and explicitly grounded in the gift of the Torah and the psalmist's loyalty to it.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Psalm_119

posts.name: Anonymous

>>34022009
>>34035768
It's very simple. When you do the Psalm Magic formula with EVERY Psalm (set a desire, read the Psalm out loud once as an incantation, then read through it again to find the occult meanings), then that's one degree of initiation. Doing it again counts as another degree, and so on. You don't have to do the Psalms in order. Don't forget that Psalm 119 is broken up into multiple Psalms.

Not recommended to rush the process, since the wisdom comes from deciphering the meanings of each Psalm. If you feel like a Psalm's calling you to go over it multiple days, do so.

Source: Ariel Gatoga and Pater Amadeus mention these in their booklets.

>>34015108
>>34015413
>God promised to give back 10x (tithe means ten) whatever's offered to Him
horrendously false. Tithe means tenTH, as in you are to give a tenth of your income (money but also produce itself as most people in history did not have income in money). The tithe was not a generous gift but required in the Mosaic law, it was to sustain the Levites and priesthood and for maintenance of the temple. This was how they stayed alive as they were not given any land inheritance in Canaan, the tithe was God's provision for them.
There is Scripture that says if you give (freely, so not as part of the tithe) to someone who you do not expect to be able to pay you back, God will repay you. But the implication there is not that the "repayment" will be a literal monetary gift or any specific concrete blessing. Rather it is that you aren't simply throwing away resources, God sees what you did as an act of kindness and obedience to His Word and He will not forget.

God owes you nothing and He never will. Any blessing you have received He gave you because of His immeasurable grace.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
>>34046467
Ego is your perception of "you" as the person you identify with, your name, your story, your family etc.
When people experience ego death they're not themselves in the strict sense of the world, it's often described as feeling of "being one with the universe" because the mental line that divides the rest of the world and you becomes blurred.
The easiest way for you to get it is think of babies before they know they're someone, they have no idea that their mom is a different entity to themselves, the moment he starts to recognize that he is himself and his mom is someone else the ego is created.
>It always gives me the idea of someone who doesn't try and stops growing for some reason.
Ego death is a state of mind that you can't stay in for long, you have it for however long you have it and then come back to be yourself in your day to day life. It's often associated with personal growth because it gives you a very different perspective about what it means to exist than what you would get from always being attatched to your ego.

Hey guys, finishing editing a never before seen Magnapinnidae ( nightmare squid, big fin squid ) video that was taken by a coworker of mine when we were working out in the Atlantic.
I think it will add some insight to how they hunt.... to this point scientists really did not know how they hunt, it was thought they drag their arms along the bottom of the ocean to ensnare prey. At the very least this video shows they has a elasticity to their arms. I seems that the length of the arms can change and shoot out several times the initial length.

The ROV working at 7k plus feet noticed the squid, moved in to film it and followed it. durring that time the squid decided to strike the ROV with it's arms.

Just thought I would share a new video with you before everyone else sees it, my project in Tahoe is not getting any film at the moment because the weather is prohibiting it. Although the work on my ROV is going great and exceeding what i thought i could build. The new ROV plus the collaboration and help i have now will surely help with the exploration on Tahoe and its undiscovered life at 1650ft. If all works out as planned i will be exploring anomalies off the coast of America withing a year or two with it, ( built to go to 7700 ft.)
Anyways, stand by for video link, i have a short time on land before we head back offshore. AMA

PS this is the 9th video of the bigfin ever, i have released three of those and the forth (a baby bigfin (like newborn) will be posted in the next few weeks.) so stay tuned for that.

chase

posts.name: Other Tahoe Anon

>>34037746
1/2

I don’t wanna harp on academics too much, because they are an important part of this, but part of me does echo the frustration Chase feels for academia. There is a problem in the academic world right now that I feel happens to all established bureaucratic organizations at some point. There is a lot of arrogance, gatekeeping from established scientists, a lot of “safe science” rather than efforts to push the envelope. Peer review committees have gone from preventing false science through rigorous review, to preventing any science they themselves want to be false. The ongoing reproducibility crisis shows that the peer reviewers arent even preventing bad science anymore even, just that which they dislike.

I believe every generation and civilization had their priest class. Our old religious priest classes have been replaced by a “scientific” priest class with the same ego and human aspect that ran organized religions into the ground. The commercialization of science and turning it into a degree mill opened up the ranks from the fringe, brilliant and dedicated, to the average person, the career student, and the politically and ego driven personalities accompanying them. Remember, the average person is much more crowdminded and weary to stand out. Most famous scientists are not, they stood out and went their own way. This is a generation of crowd-conscious science, which is inherently self-limiting to any science that challenges the status quo.
There are many, many amazing scientists still out there, but they are amazing despite the modern academic establishment, despite their nonsense and vapid conventions, rather than because of them.

posts.name: Other Tahoe Anon
posts.com:
>>34037746
>>34037898
2/2

We’re entering an age where the legitimacy of “science” is being undermined, purely because of the emergence of what is often called “scientism” a kind of religious and dogmatic offshoot of the scientific method. Scientism has become dominant over science itself, resulting in nonsense like “trust the science” in popular nomenclature. This age will involve a lot of freethinkers and fringethinkers taking things into their own hands, and dragging academia kicking and screaming toward new discoveries. Scientific leaps have historically come from the fringes, and the scientific establishment is no longer fringe.

Blog post over

Hiring the artist has changed the outlook from bad to positive which is the current situation but the outcome does not look good. The direct influences are going to be teamwork, a friend, someone to help invest into the project. The hidden influences are that taking on a cohort will lead to changes to the end vision that you have in mind. This might also mean that you may not find a partner to help shoulder the burden of finances and responsibilities and will have to delay the project further.

Help: Dont delude yourself. It's going to take time, its going to take money, it's going to take eyes on it. Even after all of that, it can still fail. A good rule is take whatever the estimated time of release and required budget is and double it.

You have to be very dedicated to the end product and have the vision in mind, planned ahead before beginning, willing to shovel money and time at it, and all for a maybe. I dont like being this harsh but the cards are there

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
Hello /div/, which tarot deck do you think is better inbetween these three: Tarot de Marseille, Etteilla Tarot and the Rider-Waite Tarot. Here is my opinion on each of them
>Tarot de Marseille: All the major arcanas are fine, however the minor arcanas are barebone which makes it difficult to give readings to people when there's so little to work with. But that makes it also the best Tarot for personal use since you can give your own meanings to the minor arcanas.
>Etteilla Tarot (I have the Lo Scarabeo version): The major arcanas differ from the usual tarot decks in the way that they directly refer to occult/esoteric principles rather than archetypes. The minor arcanas are a little less barebones since they have keywords for both upright and reverse. It's decent for giving readings but it's best as a truth-seeking/alchemical journey tarot.
>Rider-Waite Tarot: The major arcanas are just slightly better versions of the Marseille's, however the minor arcanas have full scenes to give clear interpretations to both the tarot reader and the person being read. It's no doubt the best tarot deck to give readings, however I personally found that it was sometimes lacking in my personal readings.

posts.com:
Okay, what the fuck is actually happening? The lion and the lamb are back in the Bible.

I swear, just a couple days ago I saw that Isaiah 11:6 ONLY mentioned a lamb and a wolf. Now the lion is back? And there’s also a child and a calf now. I used this Bible passage as an example of a Mandela effect just a few days ago, and there was no mention of a lion, let alone in the same VERSE. I used to be kind of skeptical about Mandela effects, but after seeing something change almost before my eyes I don’t know what to believe anymore.

The general timeline:
People remember Isaiah 11:6 mentioning a lion lying with a lamb.
Then, the lion was removed and replaced with a wolf. This freaked out a lot of people, myself included, who checked their bibles and found no mention of the lion AT ALL. Then we were told there was never a lion.
I can’t count how many times I’ve looked up Isaiah 11:6 just to verify there was never a lion.
And tonight, I looked at it again to remember the exact wording, and THE LION IS BACK. But the wolf is still there, and there is a calf and child now.

Is anyone else as surprised as me, or am I really crazy?

Also, Mandela effect general I guess. Can we try to limit general Mandela discussion to memorizing things like this that are apparently prone to change? What else should we be memorizing and look out for?

I know some of you think strongly that Mandela effect is fake or real, but it doesn’t do any good to argue, since it will never convince anyone. Let’s try to be productive?

any weird shit thats happened to you involving dreams, lucid dreams, night-terrors, sleep paralysis, ect.

posts.name: that one guy
posts.com:
ill start off with some of my experiences

from the ages of about 6-8, i had a serious problem with nonstop night terrors and lucid nightmares. most of the time i would be running from some generic horrifying monster and by the end of it, it would usually tear me apart or eat me alive. dream or not that shit felt weird, unfortunately i never went to see a doctor about it so i just kinda lived with it for a few years.

ive also had dozens of what i guess could be called "psychic" dreams, where ill dream out a whole day, or at least part of it, wake up, and then its the same day. saldy the first time i ever experienced this was on christmas day when i was around 7, and i shit you not, the look on my moms face when i told her everything that shed gotten me for christmas. she still gets uncomfy when i bring it up every now and then.

as far as lucid dream experiences, lucid nightmares are the worst fucking shit imaginable. may not be as bad for other people, im not sure, but the way i remember it is like being trapped in your own head, usually being chased or attacked by something, and while i could usually force myself to wake up, it didnt always work or at least took a while.

another lucid experience that stands out is when i was in maryland for a roadtrip across a few states. we were staying in a hotel and had been walking a lot before the night of this experience. i went to sleep and by the time i noticed i was lucid, something felt very off. normally my dreams are very realistic and lifelike, but this was very colorfully and wavy? if that makes sense. anyways, the fucked part is that this dream lasted hours, and i mean fucking hours. it wasnt a nightmare by any means, i just couldnt bring myself to wake up, and despite being lucid i didnt really have that much control over it. a few weird memories from that dream, but nothing stranger than how long it lasted. and ive tried for YEARS to replicate dreaming for that long, but have never been successful.

It is from an old religion. The Yantra are only really used by ayyanists which is a dravidian branch of hinduism that predates modern hinduism (kind of like what paganism is to modern religions). Here is the post that goes along with that picture from their patreon group:
This is the Karoopanayallayan Yantra for 6th - 15th Feb 2023.

This is different to the Arcanallayan Yantra (which is a Yantra that brings resonance with the Sun God Surya and positive Lokas). The Karoopanayallayan Yantra brings resonance with the Karoopanayal Tala Space but amplifies it on a 10 day basis by attaining resonance with two beings: Chandra (the Moon God) and Mada (the Demon born from the will of Chyavana). Thus it is made out of two Yantras: the every changing outer Chandra-Mada Yantra and the inner unchanging Karoopanayal Tala Yantra.

The Demon Mada is also known as Ukkandayyan in Dravidian Aaiyyani, and is an extremely powerful entity (so powerful that even Indra had to surrender to its power). So this combined Yantra: The Karoopanayallayan Yantra is incredibly powerful.

This Yantra shown will give you specific powerful negative energy for that week and was produced by a High Aaiyyanist. It will kick start each week with a great amount of negative energy that you can use for your own will. This is usually to gain wealth and power and commune with negative entities to gain their arcane knowledge.

As we are all part of the Marunatunilam School it is feasible to store positive energy and negative energy in our Chakra reservoirs to use as our will directs. They do not cancel each other out if you are correctly aligned in both paths. If you follow the non-Tantric path you can choose not to use this, and if you follow a Tantric path you may choose not to use the Arcanallayan Yantra. If you follow both paths as espoused by the Neutralist doctrine of Marunatunilam, then open both Yantras (Tala and Loka space).

Earth (malkuth) lies between the tree of life and the qlippoth acting as the highest spot on the qlippoth and the lowest on the tree. That said it is between both spots and you can choose to work up or down like the orange you described.
The colors of malkuth are pic related. The orangish red is described as russet. Is it similar to the color you saw?

>>34047560
There are a couple more normal possibilities:
You are comparing it to summer, where the night is shorter and generally more people are around: causing more light. Its still winter where long cold nights are the thing.
Suggestibility of a group: basic psychology proves that people want to be included and provided its not directly harmful to themselves, will tend to agree with a group or a leader. If you went around asking them "hey is it darker outside to you?" and then one person went "maybe, yea I think so" and then you report that to another they will likely agree that its darker. Night being dark isn't outrageous or harmful to them, and agreeing with their group is helpful to them for fitting in feels nice to the brain.

If you think both of these are not correct..
What immediately comes to mind is a certain cryptid I know of that causes shadows to increase. Set up a game-camera pointed away from lights and check it after the new moon in particular.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
I don't have really any particularly strong beliefs about the world, other than that love is "correct", about the information it conveys of reality to the soul.
Other than that, I dream extraordinary dreams on a regular basis, and they inform me of a view about a multidimensional universe of consciousness, dotted with planets home to sentient beings.
I was napping today, took about two hours. I dreamed of seeing some people I knew in the past, and then before I knew it I was somewhere way outside my normal local. I was with a girl, and she knew my name, but then I got separated from her and started wandering around. They had communal buildings, I was in a layer that was a dormitory, though lots of people were just hanging around in beds together, seemed to have no concept of public indencency, that was just the place to do that sort of thing.
Then I went outside. I saw on the ground a mosfet/transistor, and pulled it to my hand wiht telekinesis. I started trying to experiment with making it resonate, just on its own. It started making high frequency sound, I was trying to push it up into radio frequency, but the noise was awful and started getting me a lot of attention.
Then I saw this outbuilding that looked like some kind of science medical facility. I tried going in there, and that caused an incident where a lot of people started noticing that I was extremely out of place. One of them started slicing my hand up with a scalpal, and I started talking with them and telling them what was going on with me. I said I was from the milky way, from earth, and asked them were I was, and also importantly when I was. They said I was in Andromeda, some 41 thousand kilo lightyears from the milky way, and that it was 2500AD. I said I was from 2023AD, and thought it strange that they also used AD. They said that there had recently been a revival of belief in Jesus in their world.
I told them I meant no harm, I had just teleported here and had no idea why they saw me as a threat.

posts.name: Anonymous
posts.com:
They said they thought I had a gun, and I said I was unarmed, I turned out my pockets. They took my backpack from me, and I told them I had it because I was a student and I was studying electrical engineering.
They started to relax, and then they started bandaging my hand and arm up where it had been cut. I told them I had dreamed my way there. Then I was in some kind of bar area. A woman was taking the initiative to communicate with me. I looked at her and she pushed some buttons on a tablet and her head disappeared. Then she pushed them again and it came back. I was a bit disturbed, but it was nothing particularly out of the ordinary for dreams, so I just went with it. Then some weird sludge started leaking out of my hands. I tried shaking it off, and they started saying something about a medical condition I was experiencing, but I didn't really understand very well. Then I was looking at my hands, and my fingers started to take on a weird pentangular arrangement, like they weren't all pointing in the same direction anymore. Then I started to feel the fatique of the moment from my extradimensional transloction, and I woke up. For some minutes after awakening, I was feeling subtle telepathic impressions from the women who had been speaking to me, and I got some wording about frequency while I was trying to understand the process behind what had just occured, but I wasn't able to get much farther than that.

This dream is by no means out of the ordinary, though I've visited an andromedan world probably less than 5 times. But I have visited other worlds in the local galactic arena numerous times. I sort of got used to it, and think its wonderous, but of course nobody takes dreams or dreaming seriously. I personally take it very seriously, and it has given me the same level of serious attention, as if dreaming itself is a force of consciousness that carries me along its own mysterious plans of experience and development.

posts.name: Anonymous

>>34047634
>if you have any more instances of HER please share.
Its a girl named Sophia, who I encounter in countless dreams. But she is usually slightly different in each dream. This dream she said my real name to me, and told me she remembered me, but I questioned her a bit more and wasn't entirely convinced that she knew everything. I see the telepathic presence of a spirit entity I know as Sophia, but the spirit entity, and the astral manifestation of beings with that name, often seem different in various ways.
Its further complicated by the act of interdimensional travel and timetravel involved in most of the dreams I encounter her.
One dream I had, I encountered a Sophia soul collective, and it was like I found a galaxy of Sophia, every entity there was Sophia, thousands of manifestations.
But the Sophia I always look for is the one I knew in dreams I had of an Atlantean era of Earth.
The thing about this dream was, I was clearly in bed, looking at the spirit entity Sophia, and I was in the stage of projection where I could move my astral form and manifest myself into another world. So then I was with the Andromedan version of Sophia, who both seemed to know some of the things that the spirit version tells me, but also seemed to have a consistent temporal existence in that planetary reality of 2500AD, and that always throws my mind into a weird loop. Its like I love the Sophia, but I want to be with the one who knows my present life on earth, not the one hundreds of years in the future and millions of lightyears away. I guess I chalk that up to the fact that dream worlds always try to move one into some level of indoctrination into that world system, but the aspect of lucidity I try to cultivate is the knowledge of myself as a traveler who can move between realms and that I don't have to take any particular dream as an absolute reality. These are often in contradiction with each other.
I am fortunate that I have a telepathic experience of Sophia as a spirit.
